meanings.definition: Having a tendency to cling or adhere closely
meanings.sent1: The little kitten was the clingiest of all, always staying close to its owner.
meanings.sent2: She was the clingiest friend, never wanting to be apart for even a moment.
meanings.sent3: The clingiest sock in the laundry somehow managed to stick to everything else!
meanings.sent4: The vines in the jungle were like the clingiest of friends, wrapping tightly around each other for support.
meanings.sent5: The clingiest sticker refused to come off the paper, determined to stay put.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of clingy, describing someone or something that clings excessively or persistently
meanings.sent1: Out of all the kids, he was the clingiest, always wanting to hold hands.
meanings.sent2: The clingiest toddler in the daycare would cry whenever his mom left.
meanings.sent3: The clingiest magnet on the fridge seemed to attract all the other magnets to it.
meanings.sent4: The vines in the garden were like the clingiest of siblings, never wanting to be separated.
meanings.sent5: The clingiest fabric softener made the clothes stick together like glue.
